effectively under the hood
that deployment your current service
gets swapped out for a
two-way proxy that proxies any traffic

machine now
where you can you know run the
application play around with the traffic
do what you will
and then you can send that traffic from

back into the kubernetes cluster and
then the traffic continues

but effectively you swap out your actual
service deployment
with a two-way proxy the proxy's traffic
to and from your local machine

you can access environment variables and
secrets you can access
volumes as if you're in the cluster it's
like you're practically
in the pod that you're running your

because once you're in that pod you're

as many as your other services and
you're also in the file system
